result.execSummary:
The defendant Amber Lynn Burke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment/counseling

Absolute sobriety.
No possession/consumption of alcohol, controlled substance w/out valid Rx and/or drug paraphernalia.
Take all medications as prescribed by a Dr and approved by agent
$100 fine plus costs totaling $599 payable w/ bond posted. Submit DNA sample. Supervision fees payable to DOC during probation.

records.addlTxt: 10:39 AM Defendant Amber Lynn Burke in court.  Attorney Kaitlyn M Gradecki in court for Amber Lynn Burke. Attorney Larry Lasee in court for State of Wisconsin. State's Exhibit #1 marked/received/reviewed by the Court w/ Counsel and defendant. Defendant waives formal reading of count 1. Court reviews count 1 w/ the defendant and defendant understands the charge/possible penalties and enters a plea of GUILTY to count 1. Count 2 will be dismissed/read-in. PLQ received/reviewed by the Court. Court finds the defendant's plea to be made freely and voluntarily and accepts the plea. Factual basis found. Adjudged guilty. Victim rights. Court makes stmt. State's recommendations. Stmt by Atty Gradecki. Defendant makes stmt. Court makes stmt. Court sentence: Imposed/stayed 6 months jail, placed on DOC probation for a period of 1 year, AODA assessment, absolute sobriety, no possession of alcohol, controlled substance without valid Rx and/or drug paraphernalia, take all medications as prescribed, $100 fine plus costs totaling $599 payable w/ cash bond posted, submit DNA sample. Supervision fees payable to DOC during probation. 12 days credit.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 11, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Phone call to Karen/Atty Gradecki and Debbie/DA's office scheduled P&S on 7/11/2022 at 10:30am   , the PTC that was set on 5/19/2022 at 1pm has been canceled.
